statement.title: # Content
statement.content: $N$ numbers are given in a line, we want you to divide them into no more than $M$ piles so that the maximum number of the sum of each pile is minimal. You can't change the number's order.

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content:
The first line contains a number $T$, denote the number of test cases.

For each test case,

In the first line, you will get $2$ numbers $N$ and $M$ ($1\leq M\leq N\leq 1000$) as described above.

In the next line, you will get the $N$ integers, all the integers are in the range of $[-100,100]$.

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: For each test case, you should output a number in a line denote the minimal maximum sum.

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
2 9 3 1 9 2 4 7 3 0 6 5 3 2 1 3 -214 1

statement.title: # Note
statement.content:
In the first case, you can divide the numbers as `1 9 2 / 4 7 3 0 / 6 5`

In the second case, you can divide the numbers as `1 / 3 -2`
